page.title: 05Dry Stone Walling
page.content:
Dry stone walls can only be found in hilly areas and where there are lots of stones.They were built to keep animals in their own fields or if not they would get mixed up.They usally build them with sandstone or limestone
The sandstone in our area is millstone grit,and turns a black colour because of the acids in the rain.
The wall is built up of two sides of stones and rubble in the middle.The foundations are like a house.If one of the stones is wobbly you find a small stone which will fit underneath it stopping stone from wobbling.This is called a wedger.
